image.altText: Aerial view of the town of Alice Springs at dusk.

props.synopsis: Armed with edged weapons, the offenders allegedly demanded money, cigarettes and alcohol, with one offender holding a knife to the female victim's throat.

title.children: Alice Springs couple allegedly robbed at knifepoint in their own home

image.altText: Picture of street with shade structure with vines growing on top

props.synopsis: The $3.3 million Darwin shade structure built in 2018 continues to sizzle in the sun without cover from its slow-growing vines. Through a Freedom of Information request, the ABC has obtained new temperature data from underneath the NT government project.

title.children: Cooling performance of NT government shade structure worsening as maintenance costs soar

image.altText: Traditional owners and rangers standing on the boat, below them a spat of oysters.

props.synopsis: A group of Northern Territory traditional owners hope farming native oysters will help create much-needed jobs and income for their community.

title.children: Wadeye traditional owners start native oyster trial with 100,000 spat

image.altText: A photo of a man in a hospital bed smiling at his doctor who is wearing a facemask

props.synopsis: In Australia's biggest trauma hospital, doctors are seeing an increase in older patients suffering injuries from falls. They say it is only going to get worse.

title.children: The 'silver tsunami' is coming, and experts warn Australia needs to do more, starting now

image.altText: Teenage girls drinking from a water bottle and sticking their tongue out

props.synopsis: A small group of Israelis is using a range of tactics to delay or block the flow of aid into Gaza, saying all supplies should be blocked until the remaining hostages are released.

title.children: As Gaza teeters on the brink of famine, these teen girls are trying to block aid trucks getting in

image.altText: A boy smiling while sat in a ball pen

props.synopsis: NSW Police have concerns for a 12-year-old autistic boy living with Down syndrome who went missing in Sydney's south-west on Saturday morning.

title.children: Police urge residents to check sheds and yards as part of search for missing 12yo Sydney boy

image.altText: Back view of a women in silhouette, looking out of a window at green garden.

props.synopsis: Australians paint a stark picture of extreme measures taken to save money, telling a cost-of-living Senate inquiry they only leave the house for essentials, no longer see loved ones, and have become socially isolated.

title.children: No more weekend BBQs, family visits or going out. Why Australians are being forced to socially isolate

image.altText: Three children sit with their hands cable tied. Their faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: The video was live streamed across social media and showed three primary school aged, tear-streaked children tied together at their wrists with cable ties, waiting for police to show up.

title.children: How did we get here? The Broome incident that was 'confronting' and 'disturbing'

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Don't have the guts to front up to my actual TV show? Fine. Try this instead.

title.children: Hard Quiz: Reckon you're a trivia gun? Let's see if that confidence is misguided

image.altText: Grand Designs host Kevin McCloud on the beach.

props.synopsis: The popular British television host and architecture expert shares his thoughts on the current obsession with minimalism and his golden rules of good design.

title.children: No more glass walls and polished concrete: Kevin McCloud on the future of architecture

image.altText: Ben Sears celebrates as Marnus Labuschagne looks on

props.synopsis: Australia trails New Zealand by 203 runs after a shocking start to its run chase saw the top four dismissed for just 34 on day three of the second Test at Christchuch's Hagley Oval.

title.children: Horror start to Australia's run chase after Southee screamer claims Khawaja's wicket

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: THAT'S STUMPS! Australia 4-77 need 202 runs to win
BOWLED HIM! CAM GREEN CHOPS ON! BLACK CAPS ON FIRE!
GONE! KHAWAJA ON HIS WAY! Henry has another and Australia is crumbling!

image.altText: A man seen on video kicking a police car

props.synopsis: Police are trying to identify several men who attended a "large hooning event" on Saturday in Logan after three marked police cars were damaged.

title.children: Police seek several men after police cars damaged at 'large hooning event' involving YouTube star Spanian

image.altText: in a white blouse and cardigan is led out of a brick building by police

props.synopsis: A passing joke about a missing teenage sister and a "house of horrors" hiding dark secrets beneath the floor — three decades after police arrested Fred and Rose West, the full details of their crimes remain unclear.

title.children: Fred and Rose West claimed the lives of 12 young women and girls. Thirty years on, questions remain unanswered

image.altText: Australian Energy Minister Chris Bowen speaks to the media during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The energy minister has rubbished his shadow counterpart's claims Australia could have nuclear power plants up and running in 10 years as the Coalition prepares to announce the nuclear plan it will take to the next election.

title.children: 'Tell 'im he's dreamin', Bowen says of Coalition's 10-year nuclear claim

image.altText: A man with dark hair standing in front of parliament house in Darwin

props.synopsis: Just a week after Northern Territory Police launched a review into the true extent of racism within its own ranks, its police minister came under fire over damaging Facebook posts.

title.children: As NT Police faces racism claims, its minister's old Facebook posts raise questions of hypocrisy

image.altText: multiple bright white corals on a shallow reef

props.synopsis: Coral bleaching happens when marine heatwaves disrupt the relationship between corals and the tiny organisms that live inside them and help power their metabolism. Bleaching of the Great Barrier Reef is escalating and this week heat stress has reached record levels.

title.children: As water temperature peaks, experts fear mass coral death in the months ahead

image.altText: supermarket dumpster full of produce

props.synopsis: The Senate inquiry into supermarket prices hears from people who forage for food in bins and from a farmer who says the major supermarkets' quality guidelines are "almost impossible" to meet.

title.children: 'Dumpster divers' say people are 'furious' about the amount of food supermarkets are throwing out

image.altText: A family of 8 stands in front of a large blue and white bus with three dogs and one cat.

props.synopsis: With two adults, six kids, three dogs and one cat on board, even a 12.5m converted bus is a tight squeeze for the Honeyman family. But they say the freedom and life experience it allows are invaluable.

title.children: Forget van life — this family of eight is living the dream in a bus while travelling around Australia

image.altText: A sailing ship is seen in the harbor at Pago Pago, American Samoa

props.synopsis: Self-described long-shot candidate Jason Palmer won over American Samoa with virtual town halls and campaigners on the ground. Now he wants to follow up his victory in another US territory in the Pacific.

title.children: American Samoa's surprise caucus winner has a message for Joe Biden this election

image.altText: a street sign saying wanguri with cars driving past

props.synopsis: Three youths who stole a Darwin couple's car at knifepoint on Friday night were later carjacked by a separate pair of teens within the hour, Northern Territory Police allege.

title.children: Darwin youths who allegedly stole car at knifepoint later carjacked by teenagers

image.altText: man walking through fields of crop

props.synopsis: Water is critical to running a successful farm and these 14 Tasmanian farmers have found a way to make sure they won't struggle obtaining it again.

title.children: Farmers' brainwave transforms once-dry region to dairy and grape country

image.altText: Two men hugging at a presentation night

props.synopsis: A statement of claim is lodged in the Victorian Supreme Court alleging multiple AFL greats were among players who racially abused the Krakouer brother in the 1980s.

title.children: North Melbourne stalwart Phil Krakouer names AFL greats in racism lawsuit

image.altText: A bandicoot with a long nose sits in green undergrowth at night.

props.synopsis: The eastern barred bandicoot was formerly extinct in the wild on the Australian mainland, but an increase in numbers on Phillip Island is giving conservationists cause to celebrate.

title.children: Docile, curious bandicoots thriving on fox-free island after close call with extinction

image.altText: A crowd holding their phones in the air with the phone torches illuminated.

props.synopsis: Psychologists call what the Ballarat community is going through "collective trauma", which happens when a fundamental aspect of a community is damaged.

title.children: Alleged murder of Samantha Murphy has an entire community grieving

image.altText: boxes of tablets on a pharmacy bench top

props.synopsis: About one in seven Australians are on antidepressants. But there's relatively little official advice for coming off them, meaning people who are trying to taper off their dosage are turning to new apps to help.

title.children: It's easy to get a prescription for antidepressants in Australia, but weaning off them can be more complicated

image.altText: A man carries big lanterns called fanous to celebrate the month of Ramadan.

props.synopsis: Starting this week, more than 1.5 billion people will be fasting in the month of Ramadan. Take this quiz to find out more about one of the world's largest religious festivals.

title.children: Does gossiping break the fast? Take our quiz about Ramadan

image.altText: A series of op shop bookshelves, with books arranged by spine colour: a purple, white, green, orange and pink section

props.synopsis: Organising books by colour has helped one op shop in regional NSW sell more. Here are three different ways to organise your books at home.

title.children: How do you organise your bookshelf? A librarian, op shop and book designer weigh in

image.altText: Black and white photo of newborn baby and parents

props.synopsis: Matthew McConnell's daughter died when she was just days old. He found himself grieving and lost, but he is stepping up to support other bereaved dads and together they are finding ways to cope.

title.children: 'My mates disappeared': The dads supporting each other in the wake of unbearable tragedy

image.altText: A woman in  green shirt hands another woman a box of meat.

props.synopsis: Have you ever tried buying food direct from the producer? As the nation watches the ACCC investigation into supermarkets, more farmers are looking at ways to sell direct to consumers.

title.children: Why are some people happy to pay more if it means buying direct from farmers?

image.altText: Lily Gladstone on stage with award

props.synopsis: In the Martin Scorsese-directed film Killers of the Flower Moon, Lily Gladstone shares the screen with Leonardo DiCaprio and Robert De Niro. But most of the accolades have been reserved for Gladstone, who could make history as the first Native American woman to win Best Actress at the Oscars.

title.children: An Oscars win for Lily Gladstone could be seen as an act of atonement

image.altText: Jordyn Gray wearing earrings and a white shirt

props.synopsis: A dedicated meet-up for victim-survivors of sexual assault in the Defence Force arranged by advocacy groups will take place once a month online, and seeks to create a safe space for people to share their stories.

title.children: Jordyn was told to keep quiet about her sexual assault in the Air Force because it was 'too difficult'

image.altText: Children are pictured on the rubble on a building.

props.synopsis: Efforts to secure a deal on a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza are ongoing, Israel's intelligence agency Mossad says, despite dimming hopes for a truce during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

title.children: Israel strikes one of the largest residential towers in Rafah

image.altText: an aerial shot of a sinkhole under a commercial building in Rockdale

props.synopsis: A landslide occurs on the airport side of West Botany Street in Rockdale, about 150 metres away from where a similar incident happened on March 1.

title.children: Sinkhole opens in Sydney's south just days after similar incident

image.altText: Marcus Smith

props.synopsis: England's Marcus Smith comes up clutch to down Ireland at Twickenham, while Italy ends a home drought against Scotland.

title.children: Late English drop goal stuns Ireland, as Italy shocks Scotland at home

image.altText: Max Verstappen in a dark blue Red Bull, during a night race in Saudi Arabia, going through a corner.

props.synopsis: Verstappen is not threatened around the streets of Jeddah, finishing ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and Ferrari's Charles Leclerc who rounded out the podium.

title.children: Verstappen cruises to another win as Piastri claims fourth in Jeddah
